					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/graduate" >GRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Graduate Alumni                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-586021" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Students who have received a PhD or AM in Comparative Literature have gone on to careers in a variety of fields, in both academic and non-academic roles. Past graduate alumni include:
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Marie Louise Ascher</strong>, PhD 1997, Senior Editor, Harvard University Press; freelance translator
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://complit.cornell.edu/andrea-bachner" title="">Andrea Bachner</a></strong>, PhD 2007, Assistant Professor of Comparative Literature, Cornell University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://ritabanerjee.com/">Rita Banerjee</a></strong>, PhD 2013, Lecturer in the Institute for Indology and Tibetology, Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München; Executive Creative Director, Cambridge Writers' Workshop, Inc. 
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Susan Barba</strong>, PhD 2006, Senior Editor, New York Review of Books
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Bruce A. Beatie</strong>, PhD 1967, Professor Emeritus of Classics and Comparative Literature, Cleveland State University
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pub/steve-berrien/3b/26b/a56">Steve Berrien</a></strong>, PhD 1989, Vice Chancellor of Academic Affairs, Fletcher Technical Community College 
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Guillermo Bleichmar</strong>, PhD 2007, Professor of Liberal Arts, St. John’s College Santa Fe
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://www.northeastern.edu/cssh/faculty/erika-boeckeler" title="">Erika Boeckeler</a></strong>, PhD 2007, Assistant Professor of English, Northeastern University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Carmelita Boivin-Cole</strong>, PhD 1982, Consultant; formerly Chief Executive Officer of the Maritime Provinces Higher Education Commission, Nova Scotia and Director General of Atlantic Canada Economic Development Agency
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://tulane.edu/liberal-arts/german-slavic-studies/elio-brancaforte.cfm">Elio Brancaforte</a></strong>, PhD 2001, Associate Professor of German, Tulane University
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://complit.yale.edu/people/peter-brooks">Peter Brooks</a></strong>, PhD 1965, Sterling Professor Emeritus of Comparative Literature at Yale University, Andrew W. Mellon Foundation Scholar in the University Center for Human Values and the Department of Comparative Literature at Princeton University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://revivingcreation.org/" title="">Margaret Bullitt-Jonas</a></strong>, PhD 1984, Missioner for Creation Care at Episcopal Diocese of Western Massachusetts 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://watson.brown.edu/mes/people/vangelis-calotychos" title="">Vangelis Calotychos</a></strong>, PhD 1993, Visiting Associate Professor of Comparative Literature, Brown University
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://www.wsgr.com/WSGR/DBIndex.aspx?SectionName=attorneys/BIOS/1953.htm">Lisa Davis</a></strong>, PhD 1991, Counsel, Wilson Sonsini Goodrich &amp; Rosati 
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Siegfried (Sizzo) de Rachewiltz</strong>, PhD 1983, Director, Brunnenburg Agricultural Museum and International Study Center
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://english.okstate.edu/faculty/11-faculty/20-randi-eldevik">Randi Eldevik</a></strong>, PhD 1987, Associate Professor in Department of English, Oklahoma State University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://andersengbergpedersen.wordpress.com/">Anders Engberg-Pedersen</a></strong>, PhD 2012, Associate Professor of Comparative Literature, University of Southern Denmark 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://www.lesley.edu/about/faculty-staff-directory/christine-evans" title="">Christine Evans</a></strong>, PhD 1985, Professor of Comparative Literature and Humanities Division Director, Lesley University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://lit.mit.edu/people/sframpton/">Stephanie Frampton</a></strong>, PhD 2011, Assistant Professor of Classical Literature, Massachusetts Institute of Technology 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://ling.yale.edu/people/roberta-frank">Roberta Frank</a></strong>, PhD 1968, Marie Borroff Professor of English and Linguistics, Yale University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Brian Gilbert Freeman</strong>, PhD 2003, English Department Chair, Brunswick School, Greenwich, Connecticut
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://raphaelgolbtrial.wordpress.com/">Raphael Golb</a></strong>, PhD 1996, Internet troll  
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://volvement.blogspot.com/">Jeffrey M.Green</a></strong>, PhD 1973, Freelance translator, editor &amp; writer  
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://umaine.edu/las/deans-office/ ">Emily Haddad</a></strong>, PhD 1997, Dean of College of Liberal Arts and Sciences at the University of Maine 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pub/john-hamilton/b/2b/7b0">John Hamilton</a></strong>, PhD 1979, Business Development Executive at AT&amp;T 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://isearch.asu.edu/profile/2876775" title="">Ana Hedberg Olenina</a></strong>, PhD 2012, Assistant Professor of Comparative Literature and Media Studies at Arizona State University
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://darahorn.com/">Dara Horn</a></strong>, PhD 2006, Novelist; Literary Critic; Gerald Weinstock Visiting Lecturer in Jewish Studies, Harvard University (Fall 2014) 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://www.michelejaffe.com/">Michele Jaffe</a></strong>, PhD 1998, Novelist 
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Seung Hee Jeon</strong>, PhD 2005, Research Professor at Yonsei University; Senior Editor at Asia Publishers; freelance writer, editor and translator
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://www.koheneducationalservices.com">Robert Kohen</a></strong>, PhD 2014, Owner, Kohen Educational Services 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://www.islamicstudies.harvard.edu/faculty/luke-a-leafgren/">Luke Leafgren</a></strong>, PhD 2012, Assistant Dean of Harvard College, Mather House; freelance translator 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://nyu.academia.edu/AnneLounsbery" title="">Anne Lounsbery</a></strong>, PhD 1999, Associate Professor of Russian Literature, New York University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://www.spanport.ucsb.edu/people/juan-pablo-lupi">Juan Pablo Lupi</a></strong>, PhD 2005, Associate Professor in the Department of Spanish and Portuguese, University of California Santa Barbara 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://italian.rutgers.edu/faculty-132/faculty/marsh-david">David Marsh</a></strong>, PhD 1978, Professor of Italian, Rutgers University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://www.ici-berlin.org/profile/masnatta/">Clara Masnatta</a></strong>, PhD 2012, Postdoctoral Fellow, ICI Berlin Institute for Cultural Inquiry 
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Irving Massey</strong>, PhD 1954, Professor of English and Comparative Literature Emeritus, State University of New York at Buffalo
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://www.hws.edu/academics/wrrh/facultyProfile.aspx?facultyID=653">Margueritte Murphy</a></strong>, PhD 1985, Chair, Writing &amp; Rhetoric Program, Hobart and William Smith Colleges 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://www.winstonchurchillfoundation.org" title="">Peter C. Patrikis</a></strong>, PhD 1976, Former Executive Director Winston Churchill Foundation
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://www.roxanapopescu.com/">Roxana Popescu</a></strong>, PhD 2010, Freelance reporter, blogger; Senior Reporter for Union-Tribune newspaper 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://www.law.washington.edu/Directory/Profile.aspx?ID=602">Zahr Said</a></strong>, PhD 2003, Assistant Professor of Law, University of Washington School of Law 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://www.hood.edu/Academics/Departments/English/Faculty/Mark-Sandona.html">Mark Sandona</a></strong>, PhD 1989, Professor of English, Hood College 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://dramadance.tufts.edu/people/senelick.htm">Laurence Senelick</a></strong>, PhD 1972, Fletcher Professor of Oratory; Director of Graduate Studies in Drama, Tufts University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Jerome E. Singerman</strong>, PhD 1981, Acquisitions Editor (Senior Humanities Editor), University of Pennsylvania Press
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://complit.fas.harvard.edu/people/david-stern">David Stern</a></strong>, PhD 1980, David Starr of Classical and Modern Jewish and Hebrew Literature and Professor of Comparative Literature, Harvard University.
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://english.columbia.edu/people/profile/453">Dennis Tenen</a></strong>, PhD 2012, Assistant Professor, Department of English and Comparative Literature, Columbia University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://www.faculty.umb.edu/brian_thompson/home.htm">Brian Thompson</a></strong>, PhD 1970, Professor of French Emeritus, University of Massachusetts Boston 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://directory.salemstate.edu/profile/keja.valens" title="">Keja Valens</a></strong>, PhD 2004, Associate Professor of English, Salem State University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://www.bard.edu/academics/faculty/faculty.php?id=904">Marina van Zuylen</a></strong>, PhD 1990, Professor of French and Comparative Literature; Director, French Studies Program, Bard College 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://complit.rutgers.edu/people/faculty-mainmenu/86-people/faculty-personal-pages/139-janet-a-walker">Janet A. Walker</a></strong>, PhD 1975, Professor of Comparative Literature, Rutgers University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://complit.rutgers.edu/component/content/article?id=161:steven-f-walker">Steven F. Walker</a></strong>, PhD 1973, Professor of Comparative Literature, Rutgers University 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pub/robert-h-waugh/90/451/b64">Robert H. Waugh</a></strong>, PhD 1972, Professor Emeritus at SUNY New Paltz
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://complitforlang.ucr.edu/people/faculty/bio.html?page=ye.html">Yang Ye</a></strong>, PhD 1989, Associate Professor of Comparative Literature, University of California Riverside 
</p>

<p>
	<strong><a href="http://www.haverford.edu/religion/faculty/tzadeh/homepage/Bio.html">Travis Zadeh</a></strong>, PhD 2007, Assistant Professor in Department of Religious Studies, Yale University
</p>

<p>
	<br />Follow us via the <strong><a href="https://www.facebook.com/harvardcomplit">Comp Lit Department page</a> </strong>on Facebook<strong>!</strong>
</p>
</div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_pages_section_nav' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first last expanded active-trail active-trail menu-depth-1 menu-item-38531"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/graduate"  class="active-trail active">Graduate</a><ul class="menu clearfix"><li class="first leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-42881"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/admissions" >Admissions</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-42891"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/forms-and-resources" >Forms and Resources</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-131331"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/journalsconferences-graduate-students" >Journals/Conferences for Graduate Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-42886"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/guide-graduate-students" >Guide for Graduate Students</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-45931"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/phd-dissertations" >PhD Dissertations</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-42896"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/poggioli-colloquium" >Poggioli Faculty/Student Colloquium</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-48421"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/teaching" >Teaching</a></li><li class="leaf active-trail active-trail menu-depth-2 menu-item-106121"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/graduate-alumni"  class="active-trail active active">Graduate Alumni</a></li><li class="leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-108431"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/alumni-connect" >Alumni Directory </a></li><li class="last leaf menu-depth-2 menu-item-146616"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/secondary-field-comparative-literature" >Secondary Field in Comparative Literature</a></li></ul></li></ul></div></div></div>

href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research-guides"  title="">Library Research Guides</a></li><li class="menu-4679 menu-path-node-114746   even   last "><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/visiting-scholars"  title="">Visiting Scholars Application</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-3473 menuparent  menu-path-node-92671   even   last "><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/about"  title="">About</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-4405 menu-path-node-92716  first   odd   last "><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/contact" >Contact</a></li></ul></li></ul>

  </nav></div>		  <!--main menu region end-->
		
    
		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/graduate" >GRADUATE</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
													              <a name="main-content"></a>
															<header id="main-content-header">
									<a name="main-content"></a>
                    <h1 id="page-title">
                      Journals/Conferences for Graduate Students                    </h1>
                </header>
														
															<!--front panel regions beg-->
								<div id="content-panels" class="at-panel gpanel panel-display content clearfix">
									<div class="region region-content-top"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><div id="block-os-pages-main-content" class="block block-os-pages no-title"  module="os_pages" delta="main_content"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
  
  <div class="block-content content"><article id="node-776936" class="node node-page article clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p style="text-align:left">Suggestions from Comparative Literature Faculty and Students for Places to Present and Publish Your Work (suggestions welcome – this list is currently under construction)</p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>CLASSICS<br /><br /></strong>Journals: <a href="https://www.press.jhu.edu/journals/transactions_of_the_american_philological_association/">TAPA</a> (Transactions of the American Philological Association) /<a href="https://www.press.jhu.edu/journals/arethusa/">Arethusa</a> /<a href="http:/www.journals.aiac.org.au/index.php/IJCLTS">International</a></p>
<p><a href="http://www.springer.com/new+%26+forthcoming+titles+(default)/journal/12138">Journal of the Classical Tradition /</a><a href="http://chs.harvard.edu/CHS/article/display/1167">Classics@</a><a href="http://www.springer.com/new+%26+forthcoming+titles+(default)/journal/12138"></a> (the Center for Hellenic Studies’ on-line journal)</p>
<p></p>
<p>Conference: <a href="https://classicalstudies.org/annual-meeting/147th-annual-meeting">SCS </a>(Society for Classical Studies)</p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>CINEMA</strong></p>
<p><strong></strong>Journals: <a href="http://offscreen.com/">Offscreen</a> /<a href="http://sensesofcinema.com/">Senses of Cinema</a></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>COMPARATIVE/WORLD LITERATURE</strong></p>
<p>Journals: <a href="http://www.psupress.org/journals/jnls_cls.html">Comparative Literature Studies</a>, <a href="http://complit.dukejournals.org/">Comparative Literature</a>, <a href="http://www.brill.com/products/journal/journal-world-literature">Journal of World Literature</a> (Brill), <a href="http://docs.lib.purdue.edu/clcweb/">CLCWeb: Comparative Literature and Culture</a>. See also <a href="http://www.acla.org/resources/journals">List of ACLA Journals</a></p>
<p></p>
<p>Conferences: <a href="http://www.acla.org/">ACLA </a>(American Comparative Literature Association) /<a href="https://www.mla.org/Convention">MLA </a>(Modern Language Association)/<a href="http://www.luc.edu/mmla/">MMLA </a>(Midwest Modern Language Association) /<a href="https://www.buffalo.edu/nemla/convention.html">NeMLA </a>(New England Modern Language Association) /<a href="http://litsciarts.org/">SLSA </a>(Society for Literature, Science and the Arts) /<a href="http://narrative.georgetown.edu/conferences/">Narrative</a> /<a href="http://complit.yale.edu/graduate-program/graduate-student-handbook">Yale Comparative Literature Graduate Student Conference</a>; <a href="http://wcfia.harvard.edu/seminars/cultural_politics_graduate_student_papers">Graduate Student Papers on Cultural Politics</a> (The Weatherhead Center, chaired by Prof. Roilos)</p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>EAST ASIAN</strong></p>
<p>Journals: <a href="http://u.osu.edu/mclc/">Modern Chinese Literature and Culture</a> /<a href="https://www.dukeupress.edu/Journal-of-Chinese-Literature-and-Culture/">Journal of Chinese Literature and Culture</a>/ <a href="http://www.chineselit.com/">CLEAR</a> (Chinese Literature: Essays, Articles, Reviews)/<a href="http://journals.cambridge.org/action/displayJournal?jid=JAS">Journal of Asian Studies</a> /<a href="https://depts.washington.edu/jjs/">Journal of Japanese Studies </a>/<a href="https://jsis.washington.edu/korea/jks/">Journal of Korean Studies</a> /<a href="http://asiacenter.harvard.edu/programs/harvard-asia-quarterly">Harvard Asia Quarterly</a> (Harvard Asia Center)</p>
<p></p>
<p>Conferences: <a href="http://www.asian-studies.org/Conferences/AAS">Chinese Comparative Literature Association /Association for Asian Studies Annual Conference</a> /<a href="https://networks.h-net.org/node/20904/discussions/66865/cfp-24th-annual-meeting-association-japanese-literary-studies-uiuc">Association for Japanese Literary Studies Annual Conference</a> /<a href="https://sites.lsa.umich.edu/ncks-blog/call-for-papers-4th-international-conference-of-nextgen-korean-studies-scholars-nekst/">NEKST</a> (NextGen Korean Studies Scholars)</p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>ENGLISH  </strong></p>
<p>Journals: <a href="http://www.euppublishing.com/journal/rom">Romanticism</a> /<a href="https://www.press.jhu.edu/journals/eighteenth-century_studies/">ECS </a>(Eighteenth Century Studies) /<a href="https://www.press.jhu.edu/journals/english_literary_history/">ELH </a>(English Literary History) /<a href="http://www.press.uillinois.edu/journals/jegp.html">JEGP </a>(Journal of English and German Philology) /<a href="http://www.sel.rice.edu/">SEL </a>(Studies in English Literature) /<a href="http://www.journals.uchicago.edu/toc/mp/current">MP </a>(Modern Philology)</p>
<p></p>
<p>Conferences: <a href="https://asecs.press.jhu.edu/">ASECS</a> (American Society of 18th-c Studies) /<a href="http://www.nassr.ca/conferences">NASSR</a> (North American Society for the Study of Romanticism) /<a href="http://www.bars.ac.uk/events/intconf.php">BARS</a> (British Association for Romantic Studies) /<a href="https://newcollege.asu.edu/navsa2016">NAVSA</a> (North American Victorian Studies Association)</p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>FRENCH</strong></p>
<p>Journals: <a href="http://sites.uconn.edu/">Contemporary French and Francophone Studies /Sites</a> /<a href="http://www.nebraskapress.unl.edu/product/French-Forum,673224.aspx">French Forum</a> /<a href="https://espritcreateur.org/">L'Esprit créateur</a> /<a href="http://www.ncfs-journal.org/">19th Century French Studies</a> /<a href="http://newprairiepress.org/sttcl/">Studies in 20th and 21st Century Literature</a> /<a href="http://www.sfs.ac.uk/publications/">French Studies </a>(UK) /<a href="http://www.columbia.edu/cu/french/romanicreview/">Romantic Review</a> /<a href="https://www.press.jhu.edu/journals/new_literary_history/">New Literary History</a>/<a href="http://romancesphere.fas.harvard.edu/icb/icb.do?keyword=k56942&amp;tabgroupid=icb.tabgroup138800">Romance Sphere </a>(Harvard RLL)</p>
<p></p>
<p>Conferences:<a href="https://www.mla.org/Convention">MLA </a>(Modern Languages Association)  (divisions by century) / <a href="http://www.slu.edu/~dnickol1/wp/?page_id=10">20th and 21st Century French and Francophone Colloquium</a>/<a href="https://www.brown.edu/conference/french-studies-colloquium/">19th century French Studies Association</a> /<a href="https://kflc.as.uky.edu/">Kentucky Foreign Language Conference</a> (Lexington) /<a href="http://www.sfs.ac.uk/conferences/">Society for French Studies</a> (UK)</p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>GERMAN</strong></p>
<p>Journals: <a href="http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/journal/10.1111/(ISSN)1756-1183">German Quarterly</a> /<a href="http://ngc.dukejournals.org/">New German Critique</a> /<a href="http://monatshefte.org/">Monatshefte </a>/<a href="https://www.press.jhu.edu/journals/german_studies_review/">German Studies Review</a> /<a href="http://www.uni-konstanz.de/dvjs/editorial.htm">Deutsche Vierteljahrsschrift für Literaturund Geistesgeschichte</a> /<a href="http://www.poeticamagazine.com/">Poetica</a> /<a href="http://www.utpjournals.com/Seminar">Seminar</a></p>
<p></p>
<p>Conferences:<a href="https://www.thegsa.org/conference/current.html"> GSA</a> (German Studies Association), <a href="http://goethesociety.org/conferences/">The Goethe Society of North America</a></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>JEWISH STUDIES</strong></p>
<p>Journal: <a href="http:/www.iupress.indiana.edu/pages.php?pID=89&amp;CDpath=4">Prooftexts: A Journal of Jewish Literary History</a></p>
<p></p>
<p>Conferences: <a href="http:/www.ajsnet.org/conferences.htm">Association for Jewish Studies</a></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>MEDITERRANEAN STUDIES</strong></p>
<p>Conference: <a href="https:/meditopos.rll.lsa.umich.edu/the-meditopos-conference/">The Meditopos Conference at University of Michigan</a></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>MIDDLE EASTERN</strong></p>
<p>Journals:<a href="http://www.brill.com/journal-arabic-literature"> Journal of Arabic Literature</a>/<a href="http://www.tandfonline.com/toc/gede20/current">Edebiyat</a></p>
<p></p>
<p>Conference: <a href="http://mesana.org/annual-meeting/">MESA </a>(Middle East Studies Association)</p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>MODERNISM</strong></p>
<p>Conference: <a href="https:/msa.press.jhu.edu/conferences/">MSA </a>(Modernist Studies Association)</p>
<p></p>
<p>Journal: <a href="https://www.press.jhu.edu/journals/modernism_modernity/">Modernism/Modernity</a>, <a href="http://www.utpjournals.press/loi/md">Modern Drama</a></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>ORAL TRADITION</strong></p>
<p>Journal: <a href="http://journal.oraltradition.org/">Oral Tradition</a></p>
<p></p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>SLAVIC</strong>  </p>
<p>Journals:  <a href="http://www.russianreview.org/">The Russian Review</a> /<a href="http://www.slavicreview.illinois.edu/">The Slavic Review</a> /<a href="http://www.aatseel.org/publications/">The Slavic and East European Journal</a></p>
<p></p>
<p>Conferences:  <a href="http:/www.aatseel.org/program/">AATSEEL</a> (American Association of Teachers of Slavic and East European Languages), <a href="http://aseees.org/convention">ASEEES</a> (Association of Slavic, East European and Eurasian Studies)</p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>YIDDISH</strong></p>
<p>Journal:<a href="http://ingeveb.org/"> In geveb</a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div>
  </div></div></div></div>																																			</div>
								<!--front panel regions end-->
													
											</div>
				</div>

					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news" >NEWS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												2015 ACLA Prizes for Department Graduate Students											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-531286" class="node node-news article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">March 4, 2015</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>It is our pleasure to share the terrific news that two of our graduate students have received national accolades from the American Comparative Literature Association for their superlative work. <br /><br /> John Hyong Kim (Ph.D. 2014) has just been named the 2015 co-recipient of the Charles Bernheimer Prize, awarded annually to the best dissertation in the field of comparative literature, for his stellar dissertation "The Poetics of Diagram."<br /><br /> And Henry Bowles (G6) has just been named the 2015 recipient of the A. Owen Aldridge Prize, awarded annually to the best graduate student essay in the field of comparative literature, for his stellar essay "Psychological Realism in Early Prose Narrative."<br /><br /> John and Henry will receive their awards at the ACLA annual meeting in Seattle later this month.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->

      <h2 class="block-title">Latest News</h2>
  
  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-os_news_latest' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id='box-os_news_latest-page' data-page='0' data-delta='os_news_latest' class='os-sv-list os_sv_list_box sv-list-news sv-list-view-teaser sv-list-layout-list sv-grid-3'><article id="node-1069246" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-prof-martin-puchner-his-upcoming-new-book-written-world-power-stories"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/puchner_book.jpg?m=1507745994&amp;itok=L1iplWUD" width="100" height="100" alt="Written Word" title="New book by Professor Martin Puchner: &quot;The Written World: The Power of Stories to Shape People, History, Civilization&quot;." /></a></figure></div></div>

          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-prof-martin-puchner-his-upcoming-new-book-written-world-power-stories" rel="bookmark" target="_top">New book by Professor Martin Puchner: "The Written World: The Power of Stories to Shape People, History, Civilization".</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">

  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-spring-2017-bok-awards"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/bok_awards.jpg?m=1508249868&amp;itok=Sv-l-BWf" width="100" height="100" alt="BOK award" title="BOK award" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-spring-2017-bok-awards" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congratulations to all the Comp Lit recipients of a Spring 2017 Teaching Award from the BOK Center!</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">September 20, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Please join us in congratulating all the recipients of a <a href="http://bokcenter.harvard.edu/awards" title="Fall 2016 Certificate of Excellence and of Distinction in Teaching" target="_top">Spring 2017 Teaching Award</a> from the Bok Center in the Department of Comparative Literature! <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-spring-2017-bok-awards" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congratulations to all the Comp Lit recipients of a Spring 2017 Teaching Award from the BOK Center!</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-1033871" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-ungureanu-new-book"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/delia_book_2017_cropped_01.jpg?m=1502118219&amp;itok=gK_y2_Ek" width="100" height="100" alt="Delia Ungureanu From Paris to Tlon cropped" title="Delia Ungureanu From Paris to Tlon cropped" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-ungureanu-new-book" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congratulations to Delia Ungureanu on her upcoming new book "From Paris to Tlön: Surrealism as World Literature":</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">August 7, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Congratulations to <strong><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/people/delia-ungureanu" title="" target="_top">Delia Ungureanu</a></strong> on the advance publicity she’s already receiving for her new book <strong><em><a href="https://www.bloomsbury.com/us/from-paris-to-tlon-9781501333194/" title="" target="_top">From Paris to Tlön: Surrealism as World Literature</a></em></strong>, due out from Bloomsbury in November <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-ungureanu-new-book" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congratulations to Delia Ungureanu on her upcoming new book "From Paris to Tlön: Surrealism as World Literature":</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-1002256" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/congratulations-2017-graduates-awards"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/c.legros_thesis_cropped.jpg?m=1494602001&amp;itok=mLIgNnfh" width="100" height="100" alt="clegros" title="clegros" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/congratulations-2017-graduates-awards" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congratulations to the Class of 2017 and to the 2017 Award Recipients in Comparative Literature!</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">May 12, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<u>We are proud to announce the list of students in our graduating class of 2017:</u>
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Undergraduate Students:</strong><br />Christine Legros<br />Jiang Li<br />Juliana Sass
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Graduate Students:</strong><br />Guangchen Chen<br />Xiaolu Ma<br />Tony Qian<br />Yanping Zhang<br />Alice Xiang<br />Miya Qiong Xie<br /><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/congratulations-2017-graduates-awards" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congratulations to the Class of 2017 and to the 2017 Award Recipients in Comparative Literature!</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-993326" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/david-damrosch-elected-american-academy-arts-and-sciences"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/ddamrosch.jpg?m=1498847731&amp;itok=viuXfEv7" width="100" height="100" alt="David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences" title="David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/david-damrosch-elected-american-academy-arts-and-sciences" rel="bookmark" target="_top">David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">April 12, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>&#13;
	It is a pleasure to inform you that <strong>Professor David Damrosch</strong> has just been elected to <strong>The American Academy of Arts and Sciences</strong>.&#13;
</p>&#13;
&#13;
<p>&#13;
	<a data-url="https://www.amacad.org/content/news/pressReleases.aspx?pr=20274" href="https://www.amacad.org/content/news/pressReleases.aspx?pr=20274" title="" target="_top">More details can be found on their website.</a>&#13;
</p>&#13;
 <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/david-damrosch-elected-american-academy-arts-and-sciences" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-993011" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/small_gharavi.jpg?m=1491956469&amp;itok=0O6VIhT3" width="100" height="100" alt="Monalisa Gharavi" title="Monalisa Gharavi" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congrats to Maryam Monalisa Gharavi for making it into  "20 Translators Under 40" list after publishing two books in 2016</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">April 11, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Comp Lit Alum Maryam Monalisa Gharavi makes it into "<a href="https://theculturetrip.com/south-america/brazil/articles/20-literary-translators-under-40-maryam-monalisa-gharavi/" title="" target="_top">Culture Trip's 20 Translators Under 40</a>" list after publishing two books in 2016: <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congrats to Maryam Monalisa Gharavi for making it into  "20 Translators Under 40" list after publishing two books in 2016</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news"  class="more-link">More</a></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news" >NEWS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												Congratulations to our Graduate Students on their Prestigious Harvard and External Positions, Awards, and Fellowships!											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-835286" class="node node-news article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">May 24, 2016</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="photo no-caption clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><img class="image-style-os-news-full" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_news_full/public/complit/files/elena-miya.jpg?m=1508250337&amp;itok=WzMflTVU" width="180" height="180" alt="Elena Fratto and Miya Xie" title="Congratulations to our Graduate Students on their Prestigious Harvard and External Positions, Awards, and Fellowships!" /></figure></div></div></div><p>It is our great pleasure to announce this year's winners of the following positions and fellowships among our graduate students:<br /><br /><span style="text-decoration:underline">Job Market Success! Top Tenure Track Positions:<br /></span><br /> Elena Fratto (pictured here on the left): Assistant Professor of Slavic, Princeton University</p>
<p>Miya Qiong Xie (pictured here on the right): Assistant Professor of Chinese Literature, Dartmouth College</p>
<p><span style="text-decoration:underline"><br />2016-17 Dissertation Completion Fellowships: </span></p>
<p>Ania Aizman</p>
<p>Julia Alekseyeva: Reischauer Institute Dissertation Completion Grant</p>
<p>Guangchen Chen</p>
<p>Molly Klaisner</p>
<p>Xiaolu Ma: Reischauer Institute Dissertation Completion Grant</p>
<p>Tony Qian</p>
<p>Serge Ryappo</p>
<p>Ben Sudarsky</p>
<p>Juan Torbidoni</p>
<p>Alice Xiang</p>
<p>Miya Qiong Xie: ACLS completion fellowship</p>
<p>Simos Zeniou</p>
<p>Yanping Zhang<br /><br /><br /><span style="text-decoration:underline">2016 Summer fellowships:</span></p>
<p>Márton Farkas: Barney and Anne B. Malloy Fellowship for summer Hebrew study in Berlin</p>
<p>Rachelle Grossman: Anna Marnoy Feldberg Fellowship for summer research on Latin American Yiddish literature in Mexico</p>
<p>Rachael Lee: summer grant from the Davis Center</p>
<p>Will Tamplin: Anna Marnoy Feldberg Fellowship for summer Hebrew study in Israel</p>
<p>Juan Torbidoni: Travel Summer Research Grant from David Rockefeller Center for Latin American Studies</p>
<p><span style="text-decoration:underline"><br />2016-2017 Research/traveling/exchange fellowships:</span></p>
<p>Mel Azuaje-Alamo : Korea Institute fellowship</p>
<p>Márton Farkas: Augustus Clifford Tower fellowship</p>
<p>Raphael Koenig: CES dissertation research fellowship<br /><br />Rachael Lee: Foreign Language Area Studies Fellowship 2016-2017</p>
<p>Yun Ni: GSAS Merit/Term-time fellowship</p>
<p>Argyro Nicolaou: Minda de Gunzburg Center for European Studies Dissertation Research Fellowship<br /><br />Lara Roizen: Ecole Normale Supérieure exchange fellowship <br /><br />Thomas Wisniewski: Frederick Sheldon traveling fellowship  from the Committee on General Scholarships</p>
<p>Lusia Zaitseva: Frederick Sheldon traveling fellowship from the Committee on General Scholarships</p>
<p>Emma Zachurski: Ecole Normale Supérieure exchange fellowship</p>
<p></p>
<p> </p>
<p> </p>
<p> </p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->

	Please join us in congratulating all the recipients of a <a href="http://bokcenter.harvard.edu/awards" title="Fall 2016 Certificate of Excellence and of Distinction in Teaching" target="_top">Spring 2017 Teaching Award</a> from the Bok Center in the Department of Comparative Literature! <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-spring-2017-bok-awards" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congratulations to all the Comp Lit recipients of a Spring 2017 Teaching Award from the BOK Center!</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">August 7, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Congratulations to <strong><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/people/delia-ungureanu" title="" target="_top">Delia Ungureanu</a></strong> on the advance publicity she’s already receiving for her new book <strong><em><a href="https://www.bloomsbury.com/us/from-paris-to-tlon-9781501333194/" title="" target="_top">From Paris to Tlön: Surrealism as World Literature</a></em></strong>, due out from Bloomsbury in November <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-ungureanu-new-book" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congratulations to Delia Ungureanu on her upcoming new book "From Paris to Tlön: Surrealism as World Literature":</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/david-damrosch-elected-american-academy-arts-and-sciences" rel="bookmark" target="_top">David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">April 12, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>&#13;
	It is a pleasure to inform you that <strong>Professor David Damrosch</strong> has just been elected to <strong>The American Academy of Arts and Sciences</strong>.&#13;
</p>&#13;
&#13;
<p>&#13;
	<a data-url="https://www.amacad.org/content/news/pressReleases.aspx?pr=20274" href="https://www.amacad.org/content/news/pressReleases.aspx?pr=20274" title="" target="_top">More details can be found on their website.</a>&#13;
</p>&#13;
 <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/david-damrosch-elected-american-academy-arts-and-sciences" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-993011" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/small_gharavi.jpg?m=1491956469&amp;itok=0O6VIhT3" width="100" height="100" alt="Monalisa Gharavi" title="Monalisa Gharavi" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congrats to Maryam Monalisa Gharavi for making it into  "20 Translators Under 40" list after publishing two books in 2016</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">April 11, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Comp Lit Alum Maryam Monalisa Gharavi makes it into "<a href="https://theculturetrip.com/south-america/brazil/articles/20-literary-translators-under-40-maryam-monalisa-gharavi/" title="" target="_top">Culture Trip's 20 Translators Under 40</a>" list after publishing two books in 2016: <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congrats to Maryam Monalisa Gharavi for making it into  "20 Translators Under 40" list after publishing two books in 2016</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1393429000' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><div id="file-133626" class="file file-image file-image-png">

          <h2 class="element-invisible"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/files/complit/files/comp_lit_logo_blk.png?m=1486532377">comp_lit_logo_blk.png</a></h2>
      
  
  <div class="content">
    <img class="image-style-os-files-xxlarge" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_files_xxlarge/public/complit/files/comp_lit_logo_blk.png?m=1499733411&amp;itok=YGrMF-2l" width="303" height="70" alt="" title="" />  </div>

  <div class="block-content content"><div id='boxes-box-1387208855' class='boxes-box'><div class="boxes-box-content"><p>

		<div id="columns" class="clearfix">
			<div class="hg-container">
				<div id="content-column" role="main">
					<div class="content-inner">
					  <div class="breadcrumb"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/" >HOME</a> <span>&#47;</span> <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news" >NEWS</a> <span>&#47;</span> </div>
						
													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												Congratulations to our Graduate Students who received a Bok Center Certificate of Excellence and Distinction in Teaching!											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-165791" class="node node-news article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">March 17, 2014</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Congratulations to two of our Graduate Students, Björn Kühnicke and Lusia Zaitseva, for receiving a <a href="http://bokcenter.harvard.edu/certificates-excellence">Derek Bok Center Certificate of Excellence and Distinction in Teaching</a> for their teaching in Fall 2013!</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

				
								  <!--sidebar second region beg-->
				  <div class="region region-sidebar-second sidebar"><div class="region-inner clearfix"><section id="block-boxes-os-news-latest" class="block block-boxes block-boxes-os_sv_list_box"  module="boxes" delta="os_news_latest"><div class="block-inner clearfix">  
      <h2 class="block-title">Latest News</h2>

<article id="node-1061861" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-spring-2017-bok-awards"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/bok_awards.jpg?m=1508249868&amp;itok=Sv-l-BWf" width="100" height="100" alt="BOK award" title="BOK award" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-spring-2017-bok-awards" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congratulations to all the Comp Lit recipients of a Spring 2017 Teaching Award from the BOK Center!</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">September 20, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Please join us in congratulating all the recipients of a <a href="http://bokcenter.harvard.edu/awards" title="Fall 2016 Certificate of Excellence and of Distinction in Teaching" target="_top">Spring 2017 Teaching Award</a> from the Bok Center in the Department of Comparative Literature! <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-spring-2017-bok-awards" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congratulations to all the Comp Lit recipients of a Spring 2017 Teaching Award from the BOK Center!</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-1033871" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-ungureanu-new-book"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/delia_book_2017_cropped_01.jpg?m=1502118219&amp;itok=gK_y2_Ek" width="100" height="100" alt="Delia Ungureanu From Paris to Tlon cropped" title="Delia Ungureanu From Paris to Tlon cropped" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-ungureanu-new-book" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congratulations to Delia Ungureanu on her upcoming new book "From Paris to Tlön: Surrealism as World Literature":</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">August 7, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Congratulations to <strong><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/people/delia-ungureanu" title="" target="_top">Delia Ungureanu</a></strong> on the advance publicity she’s already receiving for her new book <strong><em><a href="https://www.bloomsbury.com/us/from-paris-to-tlon-9781501333194/" title="" target="_top">From Paris to Tlön: Surrealism as World Literature</a></em></strong>, due out from Bloomsbury in November <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-ungureanu-new-book" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congratulations to Delia Ungureanu on her upcoming new book "From Paris to Tlön: Surrealism as World Literature":</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-1002256" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/congratulations-2017-graduates-awards"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/c.legros_thesis_cropped.jpg?m=1494602001&amp;itok=mLIgNnfh" width="100" height="100" alt="clegros" title="clegros" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/congratulations-2017-graduates-awards" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congratulations to the Class of 2017 and to the 2017 Award Recipients in Comparative Literature!</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">May 12, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<u>We are proud to announce the list of students in our graduating class of 2017:</u>
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Undergraduate Students:</strong><br />Christine Legros<br />Jiang Li<br />Juliana Sass
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Graduate Students:</strong><br />Guangchen Chen<br />Xiaolu Ma<br />Tony Qian<br />Yanping Zhang<br />Alice Xiang<br />Miya Qiong Xie<br /><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/congratulations-2017-graduates-awards" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congratulations to the Class of 2017 and to the 2017 Award Recipients in Comparative Literature!</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-993326" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/david-damrosch-elected-american-academy-arts-and-sciences"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/ddamrosch.jpg?m=1498847731&amp;itok=viuXfEv7" width="100" height="100" alt="David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences" title="David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/david-damrosch-elected-american-academy-arts-and-sciences" rel="bookmark" target="_top">David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">April 12, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>&#13;
	It is a pleasure to inform you that <strong>Professor David Damrosch</strong> has just been elected to <strong>The American Academy of Arts and Sciences</strong>.&#13;
</p>&#13;
&#13;
<p>&#13;
	<a data-url="https://www.amacad.org/content/news/pressReleases.aspx?pr=20274" href="https://www.amacad.org/content/news/pressReleases.aspx?pr=20274" title="" target="_top">More details can be found on their website.</a>&#13;
</p>&#13;
 <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/david-damrosch-elected-american-academy-arts-and-sciences" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-993011" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/small_gharavi.jpg?m=1491956469&amp;itok=0O6VIhT3" width="100" height="100" alt="Monalisa Gharavi" title="Monalisa Gharavi" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congrats to Maryam Monalisa Gharavi for making it into  "20 Translators Under 40" list after publishing two books in 2016</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">April 11, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Comp Lit Alum Maryam Monalisa Gharavi makes it into "<a href="https://theculturetrip.com/south-america/brazil/articles/20-literary-translators-under-40-maryam-monalisa-gharavi/" title="" target="_top">Culture Trip's 20 Translators Under 40</a>" list after publishing two books in 2016: <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congrats to Maryam Monalisa Gharavi for making it into  "20 Translators Under 40" list after publishing two books in 2016</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>

													<section id="main-content">
								<a name="main-content"></a>
																									<header id="main-content-header">
																					<h1 id="page-title">
												New Undergraduate Program Video!											</h1>
																													</header>
																
																	<div id="content">
										<article id="node-493446" class="node node-news article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article">
  
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">December 23, 2014</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-full"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>The Department is proud to present to you a new video promoting our Undergraduate Program in Comparative Literature.</p>
<p><span><iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ymzaMaxnFy0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></span></p>
<p>For more information about the Concentration in Comparative Literature, please review <a href="http://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/prospective-students">this section</a> of our website.</p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
									</div>
								
							</section><!--main content ends-->
											</div>
				</div>

  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-spring-2017-bok-awards"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/bok_awards.jpg?m=1508249868&amp;itok=Sv-l-BWf" width="100" height="100" alt="BOK award" title="BOK award" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-spring-2017-bok-awards" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congratulations to all the Comp Lit recipients of a Spring 2017 Teaching Award from the BOK Center!</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">September 20, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Please join us in congratulating all the recipients of a <a href="http://bokcenter.harvard.edu/awards" title="Fall 2016 Certificate of Excellence and of Distinction in Teaching" target="_top">Spring 2017 Teaching Award</a> from the Bok Center in the Department of Comparative Literature! <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-spring-2017-bok-awards" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congratulations to all the Comp Lit recipients of a Spring 2017 Teaching Award from the BOK Center!</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-1033871" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-ungureanu-new-book"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/delia_book_2017_cropped_01.jpg?m=1502118219&amp;itok=gK_y2_Ek" width="100" height="100" alt="Delia Ungureanu From Paris to Tlon cropped" title="Delia Ungureanu From Paris to Tlon cropped" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-ungureanu-new-book" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congratulations to Delia Ungureanu on her upcoming new book "From Paris to Tlön: Surrealism as World Literature":</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">August 7, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Congratulations to <strong><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/people/delia-ungureanu" title="" target="_top">Delia Ungureanu</a></strong> on the advance publicity she’s already receiving for her new book <strong><em><a href="https://www.bloomsbury.com/us/from-paris-to-tlon-9781501333194/" title="" target="_top">From Paris to Tlön: Surrealism as World Literature</a></em></strong>, due out from Bloomsbury in November <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congratulations-ungureanu-new-book" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congratulations to Delia Ungureanu on her upcoming new book "From Paris to Tlön: Surrealism as World Literature":</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-1002256" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/congratulations-2017-graduates-awards"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/c.legros_thesis_cropped.jpg?m=1494602001&amp;itok=mLIgNnfh" width="100" height="100" alt="clegros" title="clegros" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/congratulations-2017-graduates-awards" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congratulations to the Class of 2017 and to the 2017 Award Recipients in Comparative Literature!</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">May 12, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	<u>We are proud to announce the list of students in our graduating class of 2017:</u>
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Undergraduate Students:</strong><br />Christine Legros<br />Jiang Li<br />Juliana Sass
</p>

<p>
	<strong>Graduate Students:</strong><br />Guangchen Chen<br />Xiaolu Ma<br />Tony Qian<br />Yanping Zhang<br />Alice Xiang<br />Miya Qiong Xie<br /><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/congratulations-2017-graduates-awards" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congratulations to the Class of 2017 and to the 2017 Award Recipients in Comparative Literature!</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-993326" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/david-damrosch-elected-american-academy-arts-and-sciences"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/ddamrosch.jpg?m=1498847731&amp;itok=viuXfEv7" width="100" height="100" alt="David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences" title="David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/david-damrosch-elected-american-academy-arts-and-sciences" rel="bookmark" target="_top">David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">April 12, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>&#13;
	It is a pleasure to inform you that <strong>Professor David Damrosch</strong> has just been elected to <strong>The American Academy of Arts and Sciences</strong>.&#13;
</p>&#13;
&#13;
<p>&#13;
	<a data-url="https://www.amacad.org/content/news/pressReleases.aspx?pr=20274" href="https://www.amacad.org/content/news/pressReleases.aspx?pr=20274" title="" target="_top">More details can be found on their website.</a>&#13;
</p>&#13;
 <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/david-damrosch-elected-american-academy-arts-and-sciences" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about David Damrosch elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences</span></a></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
<article id="node-993011" class="node node-news node-teaser article modified-in-os_news_process_node clearfix" role="article" target="_top">
  <div class="field field-name-field-photo field-type-image field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><figure class="clearfix field-item even"><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list"  target="_top"><img class="image-style-os-square-100-100" src="//static.hwpi.harvard.edu/files/styles/os_square_100_100/public/complit/files/small_gharavi.jpg?m=1491956469&amp;itok=0O6VIhT3" width="100" height="100" alt="Monalisa Gharavi" title="Monalisa Gharavi" /></a></figure></div></div>
      <header class="node-header">
              <h1 class="node-title" rel="nofollow">
          <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list" rel="bookmark" target="_top">Congrats to Maryam Monalisa Gharavi for making it into  "20 Translators Under 40" list after publishing two books in 2016</a>
        </h1>
          </header>
  
  
  <div class="node-content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-news-date field-type-datestamp field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single">April 11, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden view-mode-teaser"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>
	Comp Lit Alum Maryam Monalisa Gharavi makes it into "<a href="https://theculturetrip.com/south-america/brazil/articles/20-literary-translators-under-40-maryam-monalisa-gharavi/" title="" target="_top">Culture Trip's 20 Translators Under 40</a>" list after publishing two books in 2016: <a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news/congrats-monalisa-gharavi-20-translators-under-40-list" class="node-readmore" target="_top">Read more <span class="element-invisible"> about Congrats to Maryam Monalisa Gharavi for making it into  "20 Translators Under 40" list after publishing two books in 2016</span></a></p></div></div></div>  </div>

  
  
  </article>
</div><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/news"  class="more-link">More</a></div></div></div>
  </div></section></div></div>				  <!--sidebar second region end-->
        
			</div>
		</div>
		<!--footer region beg-->
		<footer id="footer" class="clearfix" role="contentinfo">

class="menu-12723 menu-path-complitfasharvardedu-people-role-graduate-students   odd  "><a href="http://complit.fas.harvard.edu/people/role/graduate-students" >Graduate Students</a></li><li class="menu-12727 menu-path-complitfasharvardedu-people-role-tutorial-board   even  "><a href="http://complit.fas.harvard.edu/people/role/tutorial-board" >Undergraduate Tutorial Board</a></li><li class="menu-12718 menu-path-complitfasharvardedu-people-role-emeritus-faculty   odd  "><a href="http://complit.fas.harvard.edu/people/role/emeritus-faculty"  title="">Emeriti / Emeritae Faculty</a></li><li class="menu-12729 menu-path-complitfasharvardedu-people-role-visiting-scholar   even   last "><a href="http://complit.fas.harvard.edu/people/role/visiting-scholar"  title="">Visiting Scholars</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-3472 menu-path-node-92666   even  "><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/news-events"  title="">News</a></li><li class="menu-3814 menuparent  menu-path-node-105801   odd  "><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/resources"  title="">Resources</a><span class="open-submenu"></span><ul><li class="menu-4406 menu-path-node-114731  first   odd  "><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/publications" >Publications</a></li><li class="menu-12979 menu-path-complitfasharvardedu-publication-subsidies   even  "><a href="http://complit.fas.harvard.edu/publication-subsidies" >Publication Subsidies </a></li><li class="menu-4407 menu-path-node-127646   odd  "><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/research-guides"  title="">Library Research Guides</a></li><li class="menu-4679 menu-path-node-114746   even   last "><a href="https://complit.fas.harvard.edu/pages/visiting-scholars"  title="">Visiting Scholars Application</a></li></ul></li><li class="menu-3473 menuparent  menu-path-node-92671   even   last
